title.rendered: Apply Now | Crandall University Admission Requirements 2024

content.rendered:
Crandall University Admission Requirements, Steps to apply for admission, Application deadline, English Language required Score, Application fee$100.CAD

Crandall University Admission is ongoing for all interested candidates who want to apply for application to Crandall University.

Crandall University Admission Requirements

Applying to Crandall university

Please follow the outlined steps to ensure your application is processed in an appropriate manner

  1. Ensure you Complete our online International student application
  2. Give the required supporting documents
  3. Official transcripts from all educational institutions previously  attended
  4. language test scores (IELTS Academic or equivalent)
  5. Duplicate of a valid passport
  • Must include photograph, name, country of origin, expiry date.
  1. $100 CAD Application fee

This will be paid through paymytuition.com

Application deadlines for international students

Starting  Date Application Period
September January 1 – April 1
January May 1 – August 1
May September 1 – December 1

*Please note that: not all programs have begun dates every term.

The English Language required scores by testing system:

  • IELTS – Academic: a maximum score of 6.5 in general, with a minimum of 6.0 in each area. (International English Language Testing System)
  • TOEFL-IBT: a bare minimum of 90 in general, with a minimum of 21 in each area. (Internet-Based Test)
  • TOEFL-CBT: least amount of 236 generally, with a minimum TWE 4.5. (Computer-Based Test)
  • TOEFL-PBT:a minimum 580 overall, minimum TWE 4.5. (Paper-Based Test)
  • CAN-Test: minimum of 4.5 in general, with a minimum 4.0 in each area. (Canadian Test of English for Scholars and Trainees)
  • CAEL: minimum band 70 overall, minimum 60 in each area. (Canadian Academic English Language Assessment)
  • MELAB: minimum 85 overall, minimum 80 in each area. (Michigan English Language Assessment Battery)
  • CLB: minimum 9 overall, at least a bare minimum of 8 in each area. (Canadian Language Benchmarks)
  • Common European Framework:
  • Cambridge English Scale: maximum in a general score of 176 from C1 Advanced. No less than 169 in any paper.
  • PTE (Pearson) Academic: least score of 56

See also>>>>>>NSCAD Admission Requirements and Application Processes
